attributes.action: NHS Staff who work Christmas or New Year to be paid Bank Holiday hours
attributes.additional_details: The bank holiday is paid but to staff who work on the Monday and Tuesday, thus those who work the key date aren't rewarded.  Yet 3 days after Christmas there are more staff back at work and then the bank holiday payment is given; this is therefore a more expensive and unfair system.
attributes.background: Christmas and New Year are the only bank holidays that are on a fixed date. This means that they can fall on a Saturday, where at present the staff are paid Saturday rate (a lesser rate).

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand from NHS guidance that where Christmas Day or New Years Day fall on a Saturday, they should be treated as public holidays for employment purposes, subject to some other rules. You can find out more here:

https://www.nhsemployers.org/tchandbook/annex-21-to-25/annex-25-arrangements-for-general-and-public-holidays

So we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to do. You may need to take the issue up with local NHS managers.
